message_1: A study on the average sleep time of college students was conducted. A sample of 36 students revealed an average sleep time of 6.8 hours with a standard deviation of 1.2 hours. Find the 95% confidence interval for the true average sleep time of college students.
message_2:
To find the 95% confidence interval for the true average sleep time of college students, we will use the formula for the confidence interval of a sample mean:

CI = x̄ ± (Z * (σ / √n))

where:
CI = confidence interval
x̄ = sample mean (6.8 hours)
Z = Z-score for the desired confidence level (1.96 for 95% confidence level)
σ = standard deviation (1.2 hours)
n = sample size (36 students)

First, we need to calculate the standard error (SE):

SE = σ / √n = 1.2 / √36 = 1.2 / 6 = 0.2

Now, we can find the margin of error (ME):

ME = Z * SE = 1.96 * 0.2 = 0.392

Finally, we can calculate the confidence interval:

CI = x̄ ± ME = 6.8 ± 0.392

Lower limit of CI = 6.8 - 0.392 = 6.408 hours
Upper limit of CI = 6.8 + 0.392 = 7.192 hours

So, the 95% confidence interval for the true average sleep time of college students is (6.408 hours, 7.192 hours).
